verbose_text: Compared with aspirin, salsalate, a nonacetylated dimer of salicylate, is an equipotent inhibitor of NF-kappaB but a much weaker inhibitor of the cyclooxygenase enzymes; therefore it is not associated with an increased risk of bleeding and is clinically safer.
evidence: salsalate, a nonacetylated dimer of salicylate, is an equipotent inhibitor of NF-kappaB
